value.name: Labour Proposes Extension of Equal Pay Rights to Black, Asian and Minority Staff
value.description: As the political debate on this matter intensifies, the spotlight remains on the government and other political parties to outline their stance on equal pay and contribute to shaping a more equitable future for all workers in the UK.

value.name: Andy Reed Think Tank launches 2024 election manifesto for physical activity
value.description: In a newly-launched manifesto, physical activity sector stakeholders are calling for the next UK government to promote active environments, cut red tape and elevate the status of PE in schools.

value.name: Apparently Gen Z Men Are Leaning Conservative While Gen Z Women Are More Liberal, And It’s Making Dating Really Hard
value.description: The research may help to explain the debate over whether Gen Z is more progressive or conservative, as studies often conflictingly report Gen Z is left leaning on some issues, but conservative on others.

value.name: Labour’s insulation policy will cost up to £13bn a year, Treasury claims
value.description: Party says its green measures would cost Exchequer a maximum of £6 billion a year, but Government’s analysis says it would be double that

value.name: The Guardian view on public service queues: a grim symbol of chronic underinvestment
value.description: The UK state is crumbling through sustained underinvestment and a myopic political fixation on cutting spending without regard for long-term social consequences. Although notionally NHS spending was “ringfenced” in George Osborne’s austerity budgets ...

value.name: Taxpayers are being ‘scammed’ by Archbishop of Canterbury, says Tory MP
value.description: Tim Loughton’s question follows news that 40 asylum seekers on the Bibby Stockholm barge had come forward to convert to Christianity.

value.description: British pop singer-songwriter Declan McKenna is back with his third studio album, the bright “What Happened to the Beach?”

value.name: Brianna Ghey’s father demands apology from Sunak over transgender jibe
value.description: The father of murdered teenager Brianna Ghey has demanded an apology from Rishi Sunak after he made a “dehumanising” transgender joke in the Commons while the victim’s mother visited Parliament.

value.name: Odds of Reform UK pulling off shock by-election victory slashed with Tory voters on strike
value.description: Speculation is mounting that Reform UK could cause "a political earthquake" in next week's Wellingborough by-election after bookmakers suddenly slashed the odds of the party's candidate Ben Habib. Mr Habib entered the race at a distant third favourite of ...

value.name: PMQs: Political leaders send best wishes to King Charles
value.description: Opening PMQs, Rishi Sunak, Sir Keir Starmer and Stephen Flynn wish a speedy recovery to the monarch following his cancer diagnosis. Business Secretary Kemi Badenoch says the business model of the Post Office "just wasn't working".

value.name: See which political writing triumphed at The Parliamentary Book Awards 2024
value.description: The Winding Stair by Conservative MP Jesse Norman won in the Best Non-Fiction/Fiction by a Parliamentarian category. This novel "tells the story of two founders from our modern world and their battle for power, pre-eminence and the hand of the most eligible women in the realm".

value.name: Row erupts over cost of Labour's home insulation plan
value.description: Labour has rejected as "bogus" an analysis by government officials that its plan to improve home energy efficiency would cost £12-15bn a year. The party has said the measures, part of a wider £28bn green investment plan, would be capped at £6bn a year.

value.name: Sinn Fein says US visit will highlight ‘Palestinian freedom’ and ‘demand end to Israel’s war’
value.description: Sinn Fein has reiterated the party will use their annual Washington St Patrick’s Day trip to highlight solidarity with those living in Gaza.

value.name: Gaza ceasefire: Israel's PM Benjamin Netanyahu rejects Hamas's proposed terms
value.description: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has rejected Hamas's proposed ceasefire terms - saying "total victory" in Gaza is possible within months. He was speaking after Hamas laid out a series of demands in response to an Israel-backed ceasefire proposal.
